rules: Rule1: Either the gallery closes the exhibition, or it is not the case that the gallery opens the exhibition.
Rule2: If the visitor attends the exhibition, then it is not the case that the gallery closes the exhibition.
Rule3: Whenever the visitor buys the artwork, the visitor attends the exhibition.
Rule4: The visitor buys the artwork or the visitor photographs the artwork.
Rule5: Provided that the visitor photographs the artwork, the visitor attends the exhibition.
Rule6: Under the condition that the critic reviews the exhibition, the exhibition is successful.
Rule7: Either the critic reviews the exhibition, or the media publishes the review.
Rule8: Whenever the media publishes the review, the article informs the public.
Rule9: If the media publishes the review, then the exhibition educates the public.
Rule10: If the review influences public opinion, then under the condition that the media publishes the review, the exhibition is successful.
Rule11: In the event that the exhibition generates revenue, the review influences public opinion.
Rule12: Whenever the corporation sponsors the exhibition, the brand promotes the exhibition.
Rule13: Either the corporation sponsors the exhibition, or the patron donates to the exhibition.
Rule14: If the patron donates to the exhibition, then the exhibition generates revenue.
Rule15: If the gallery displays the painting, then provided that the exhibition is not successful, the artist does not have permission for the gallery.
Rule16: In the event that the catalog contains an error, the publisher corrects the error.
Rule17: Either the gallery sells the catalog, or the exhibition is successful.
Rule18: If the publisher distributes the catalog, then the printer prints the catalog.
Rule19: If the artist creates the sculpture, then the jury accepts the sculpture.
Rule20: Either the artist creates the sculpture, or the gallery displays the painting.
Rule21: In the event that the exhibition arranges the layout, the curator approves the selection.
Rule22: If the curator consults the artist, then under the condition that the jury selects the artwork, then provided that the artist submitted the sculpture, the exhibition includes the sculpture.
Rule23: Supposing that the technician installs the lighting, the exhibition arranges the layout.
Rule24: Either the technician installs the lighting, or the artist adjusts the placement.
Rule25: If the curator coordinates the installation, then under the condition that the artist adjusts the placement, the curator consults the artist.
Rule26: Either the curator coordinates the installation, or the gallery director supervises the installation.
Rule27: Provided that the gallery director supervises the installation, then whenever the artist adjusts the placement, the curator consults the artist.
Rule28: If security restricts access, then it is not the case that the gallery opens the exhibition.
Rule29: Supposing that the guard monitors the area, the gallery does not open the exhibition.
Rule30: If the gallery implements security, then either security restricts access or the guard monitors the area.
Rule31: Either the security head authorizes access, or the staff bypasses the protocol.
Rule32: If the staff bypasses the protocol, then either the manager overrides the restriction or the gallery implements security.
Rule33: Whenever the museum preserves the artwork, the archivist documents the exhibition.
Rule34: Either the museum preserves the artwork, or the collection loans the piece.
Rule35: If the collection loans the piece, then under the condition that the security head authorizes access, then either the manager overrides the restriction or the gallery implements security.
Rule36: Either the expert attributes the artwork, or the laboratory authenticates the artwork.
Rule37: Supposing that the laboratory authenticates the artwork, then in the event that the visitor does not attend the exhibition, the scholar does not study the artwork.

Rule38: If the publication cites the research, then either the academic researches the artist or under the condition that it is not the case that if the expert attributes the artwork then provided that the visitor does not attend the exhibition the scholar does not study the artwork, the historian disputes the attribution.
Rule39: Either the publication cites the research, or the catalog references the study.
Rule40: If the artist violates the copyright, then the owner sues for infringement.
Rule41: Supposing that the artist violates the copyright, it is not the case that the owner sues for infringement.
Rule42: Either the artist violates the copyright, or the review influences public opinion.
Rule43: Either the artist submitted the sculpture, or the jury rejected the sculpture.
Rule44: Provided that the printer reproduces the image, it is not the case that the publication credits the artist.

Rule45: Either the printer reproduces the image, or under the condition that it is not the case that if the exhibition does not generate revenue then the image is licensed for reproduction, the parties settle the dispute.
Rule46: If the agent negotiates the rights, then under the condition that the printer reproduces the image, the publication credits the artist.
Rule47: Either the agent negotiates the rights, or the artist grants permission.
Rule48: If the artist grants permission, then the contract is signed with terms.

Rule49: Either the company infringes the copyright, or under the condition that the lawyer protects the rights, then provided that the contract is signed with terms, then whenever the printer reproduces the image, the publication credits the artist.
Rule50: If the journalist reports the event, then under the condition that the article informs the public, the exhibition is successful.
Rule51: Whenever the reporter interviews the artist, the journalist reports the event.
Rule52: If the jury rejected the sculpture, then it is not the case that the jury accepted the sculpture.
Rule53: Supposing that the media covers the opening, the journalist reports the event.
Rule54: Under the condition that the critic writes the analysis, the reporter interviews the artist.
Rule55: Either the critic writes the analysis, or the station broadcasts the segment.
Rule56: Provided that the crew films the documentary, then under the condition that the station broadcasts the segment, the media covers the opening.
Rule57: If the photographer photographs the installation, then provided that the station broadcasts the segment, the media covers the opening.
Rule58: Whenever the studio produces the film, then either the crew films the documentary or the photographer photographs the installation.

Rule59: If the educator plans the program, then under the condition that it is not the case that if the exhibition educates the public then the exhibition is successful, the workshop organizes the activity.
Rule60: Provided that the student participates in the tour, the visitor learns the technique.
Rule61: Either the student participates in the tour, or under the condition that the educator does not plan the program, the administrator cancels the event.
Rule62: If the artist demonstrates the method, then the workshop teaches the skill.
Rule63: Whenever the workshop teaches the skill, the visitor does not learn the technique.
Rule64: Either the gallery opens the exhibition, or the exhibition is successful.
Rule65: Provided that the contract offers the exhibition, the gallery commissions the artist.
Rule66: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the brand promotes the exhibition then the exhibition generates revenue, the sponsor withdraws funding.
Rule67: Supposing that it is not the case that if the catalog features the artwork then the exhibition is successful, the catalog contains an error.
Rule68: If it is not the case that if the catalog contains an error then it is not the case that the publisher corrects the error, the catalog is reprinted as a new edition.
Rule69: Provided that it is not the case that if the printer prints the catalog then it is not the case that the gallery sells the catalog, the printing of the catalog is delayed.
Rule70: Supposing that it is not the case that if the printer prints the catalog then it is not the case that the gallery sells the catalog, the artist practices the discipline.
Rule71: Whenever it is not the case that if the printer prints the catalog then it is not the case that the gallery sells the catalog, the printing of the catalog is not delayed.

Rule72: Provided that it is not the case that if the catalog references the study then either the academic researches the artist or under the condition that it is not the case that if the expert attributes the artwork then under the condition that the visitor does not attend the exhibition the scholar does not study the artwork the historian disputes the attribution, it is not the case that the author corrects the citation.
Rule73: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the artist submitted the sculpture then the exhibition includes the sculpture, the artist appeals the decision.
Rule74: Supposing that it is not the case that either the art market influences prices or the review influences public opinion, the value of the artwork does not fluctuate.
Rule75: Provided that it is not the case that if the collector acquires the piece then the artwork appreciates in value, the owner sells the collection.
Rule76: Whenever it is not the case that if the exhibition educates the public then the exhibition is successful, the workshop does not organize the activity.

Rule77: Provided that it is not the case that if the critic recognizes the talent then either the art school graduates the student or either the student exhibits the work or under the condition that the apprentice studies with the master then provided that the artist practices the discipline the student masters the craft, the contract offers the exhibition.

Rule78: If it is not the case that provided that it is not the case that if the catalog references the study then either the academic researches the artist or under the condition that it is not the case that if the expert attributes the artwork then under the condition that the visitor does not attend the exhibition the scholar does not study the artwork the historian disputes the attribution the author corrects the citation, the journal retracts the article.

Rule79: Supposing that it is not the case that under the condition that it is not the case that either the art market influences prices or the review influences public opinion the value of the artwork fluctuates, the collector acquires the piece.

Rule80: Provided that it is not the case that under the condition that it is not the case that either the art market influences prices or the review influences public opinion the value of the artwork fluctuates, the artwork does not appreciate in value.
Rule81: Provided that the visitor does not attend the exhibition, the scholar studies the artwork.
Rule82: Whenever the exhibition does not generate revenue, the image is not licensed for reproduction.
Rule83: Provided that the exhibition is not successful, the artist has permission for the gallery.
